website_summaries.verdict: The Arc’teryx Norvan LD GTX is explicitly designed for extended trail runs across different types of weather or trail conditions. Users mostly praise the shoe for its lightweight construction, and functional support. The shoe’s outsole is also commended for its versatile grip on technical trails. If anything, it’s just that some Norvan LD GTX shoes were manufactured with less waterproofing capabilities that were noted by some users. Other than that, this trail running shoe from Arc’Teryx has received positive reviews for its overall excellent running performance, especially on challenging trails.
pros: Majority of Arc’teryx Norvan LD GTX users like the shoe’s efficient breathability
Most wearers are commending the shoe for being durable
Several users say that the shoe’s trail running performance proved to last all-day
A lot of users also give praise to the comfort provided by the Norvan LD GTX on extended trail runs
A number of users note that the shoe’s single-layer mesh upper is lightweight and air-permeable
Most of the wearers say that the shoe’s GORE-TEX® feature delivers reliable waterproof performance
The shoe’s excellent arch support is well received a lot of wearers
cons: One reviewer has said that the shoe is roomy at both the front and rear saying it may cause the shoe to be too wide for wearers with narrow feet and heels
Some users say that some Norvan LD GTX shoes are manufactured not to have good quality when it comes to the waterproofing feature

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes! Mine unfortunately had a flaw on them ...
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes! Mine unfortunately had a flaw on them that I would not expect to ever have from this amazing brand. Overall, I like the shoes a lot, just very sad that I got defective shoes, the same as what I could and should have gotten directly from Arc’teryx for the same price with a virtual guarantee this wouldn’t happen.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Jermann

customer_reviews.title: My husband is happy
customer_reviews.text: These shoes were impossible to find for my husband on the Arcteryx website, the size 13 was always sold out. We found one pair on Amazon and had to get the quickly. They fit great and match so many things.
customer_reviews.author: Header

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: Love love love these shoes. The only thing. Would change is to add a pull on loop on the heel.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No heel support.
customer_reviews.text: Feels like you’re wearing a slipper. There is no padding whatsoever around the heel, so is slides as you walk, much less run.
customer_reviews.author: TrueRoan

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are not waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: They are not waterproof. The first time I walked in the snow with them they were soaked through in 5 minutes. Go with the Salomon XA Elevate GTX if you're looking for a good actually waterproof trail runner.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes
customer_reviews.text: They seem good . Have worn them a few times and I like them
customer_reviews.author: Trev

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: The fit is quite OK, but after my first walk in the rain for 10 min, my socks totally soaked, both of the inner sides of shoes are wet. It's NOT WATERPROOF.
customer_reviews.author: Alston Hsu

customer_reviews.title: Great feel, will not fall off
customer_reviews.text: Good feel and support, interested to see how long the grips last
customer_reviews.author: Venessa M.

customer_reviews.title: ONLY NICE WHEN NEW
customer_reviews.text: After 4 month of use it started to tear apart

customer_reviews.title: just what i hoped for
customer_reviews.text: This is a great shoe, at least after 2 weeks of wearing it. Very comfortable, well built, great material...fabulous
